content.question:
Researchers have discovered details about apoptosis (programmed cell death) by studying embryologic development of a nematode worm, Caenorhabditis elegans. Apoptosis is a normal developmental process in C. elegans. They found several genes involved in apoptosis, including <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="c e d 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> . The <math alttext="c e d 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene was found to promote cell death, and <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to inhibit it. The <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene serves as a regulator that prevents apoptosis in the absence of a signal promoting apoptosis.
Which of the following statements best justifies the claim that changes in the expression of <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> in C. elegans can affect regulation of apoptosis in the cell?

choices.label: An experiment showed that a mutation in the <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene led to excessive cell death in C. elegans.

An experiment showed that the <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene normally produces a protein that promotes excessive cell death in C. elegans.

A mutation in <math alttext="c e d 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> will cause <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to be incorrectly transcribed.

Apoptosis is dependent on a signal from the <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene in C. elegans.

content.answer: An experiment showed that a mutation in the <math alttext="c e d 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>d</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene led to excessive cell death in C. elegans.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
